com.microfocus.adm.pulse.pluginapi.chain

Interface PulseChainAbortMonitor


  • public interface PulseChainAbortMonitor

    Allows a PulseChainStepPlugin to check to see if the chain has been aborted and allow it to stop processing the step.

    Since:
    19.1.1

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isChainAborted()
      Call to check if the current step should be aborted.

    • Method Detail

      • isChainAborted

        boolean isChainAborted()

        Call to check if the current step should be aborted. This can be used as an indicator by the chain plugin to safely stop processing and release any resources it has. It is recommended to make use of this rather than risk the plugin being shutdown forcibly by the Pulse Agent.

        Returns:
        true if the chain has been aborted and the chain step should stop.
        Since:
        19.1.1
